background: An international goods exporter requires transportation of goods using ships and planes, each with distinct capacities and fuel consumptions.
constraints: Number of ship trips is non-negative
Number of plane trips is non-negative
At least MinContainers containers must be transported
At most MaxPlaneTrips plane trips can be made
At least MinShipTripPercentage% of all trips must be by ship
objective: Minimize the total amount of fuel used for transporting the containers
description: An international goods exporter uses ships and planes to transport goods. A ship can take \param{ShipCapacity} containers worth of goods and uses \param{ShipFuel} liters of fuel per trip. A plane can take \param{PlaneCapacity} containers worth of goods and uses \param{PlaneFuel} liters of fuel per trip. The company needs to transport at least \param{MinContainers} containers worth of goods. In addition, there can be at most \param{MaxPlaneTrips} plane trips made and a minimum of \param{MinShipTripPercentage} of the trips made must be by ship. How many of each trip should be made to minimize the total amount of fuel consumed?

parameters.definition: Fuel used by a ship per trip
Fuel used by a plane per trip
Minimum total containers that need to be transported
Minimum percentage of trips that must be made by ship
